item.title: How to SSH Back to Local Machine Via Reverse Shell
item.description: Situation Link to heading Your local machine is connected to the internet via a router that do not have control over. You are able to SSH into your work machine in another building/office without issues (connected via ethernet with static IP etc), but what if you want SSH access back to your local machine while in office? This can be achieved with reverse shell. Configuration Link to heading On the work machine (which acts as the server too): sudoedit /etc/ssh/sshd_config
